meanings.definition: An association of manufacturers or suppliers with the purpose of maintaining prices at a high level and restricting competition.
meanings.sent1: The cartels in the industry worked together to keep prices high.
meanings.sent2: The government cracked down on illegal cartels that were fixing prices.
meanings.sent3: The cartels decided to have a picnic to discuss their pricing strategies.
meanings.sent4: The cartels were like a group of powerful overlords controlling the market.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cartels as price-fixing villains stuck in people's minds.

meanings.definition: A coalition or cooperative arrangement between political parties or factions.
meanings.sent1: The cartels of political parties joined forces to win the election.
meanings.sent2: The two cartels in parliament worked together to pass the new law.
meanings.sent3: The cartels decided to throw a party to celebrate their alliance.
meanings.sent4: The cartels were like a united front against their common enemy.
meanings.sent5: The idea of political cartels forming alliances was both intriguing and concerning.
